definitions: process of joining two or more things together to form single entity
nuclear reaction where atomic nuclei combine to form heavier nucleus releasing energy
musical style blending different genres especially jazz with rock or funk
examples: The fusion of different cultures created a unique cuisine
Cell fusion occurs during fertilization of egg and sperm
Nuclear fusion powers the sun and other stars continuously
Scientists work on controlled fusion for clean energy production
Jazz fusion emerged in the late 1960s and 1970s
The band plays fusion combining Latin rhythms with jazz

definitions: quality of being pointless or having no useful result despite effort expended
examples: She recognized the futility of arguing with closed minds
The futility of their attempts became painfully obvious eventually

definitions: early twentieth century artistic movement emphasizing speed technology and modernity
concern with events and trends relating to the future
examples: Italian futurism influenced art architecture and literature significantly
The futurism exhibition showcased dynamic sculptures and paintings
Corporate futurism helps companies anticipate technological changes ahead
His futurism led him to invest in emerging technologies

definitions: artist or supporter of the futurism artistic movement
person who studies or predicts future trends and developments
examples: The futurist painters rejected traditional artistic conventions completely
Italian futurist Marinetti wrote the movement's founding manifesto
The futurist predicted widespread adoption of artificial intelligence
Corporate futurists help companies prepare for technological changes

definitions: quality or state of being in the future or time yet to come
examples: The futurity of space colonization remains highly uncertain today
We cannot know the futurity of current technological developments

definitions: device containing combustible material for detonating explosive charge or igniting something
examples: The bomb squad carefully removed the fuze from the device
Artillery shells have fuzes that trigger upon impact or timer

definitions: mass of fine light fibers or particles
blurred or distorted sound especially in music
informal term for police or police officers
examples: The peach had soft fuzz covering its skin completely
She brushed the fuzz off her favorite wool sweater
The guitar amp produces warm fuzz at high volumes
The recording had too much fuzz to hear clearly
The fuzz showed up just as the party ended
Watch out for the fuzz patrolling this neighborhood tonight

definitions: idle chatter or talk especially about trivial matters
examples: Their endless gab about celebrities bored everyone at lunch
She has the gift of gab and entertains easily

definitions: triangular upper part of wall at end of ridged roof
examples: The house featured decorative gables on all four sides
Birds nested in the gable above the front entrance

definitions: fly that bites livestock especially horses and cattle
person who persistently criticizes or provokes others with new ideas
examples: Gadflies tormented the horses throughout the humid summer months
The cattle swished their tails against annoying gadflies constantly
The journalist acted as gadfly to corrupt city officials
Every democracy needs gadflies who challenge the status quo

definitions: small mechanical or electronic device with practical use often novel
examples: The kitchen gadget peels and cores apples in seconds
He loves collecting the latest tech gadgets and gizmos

definitions: barbed spear or hook for landing large fish
embarrassing mistake or social blunder
examples: The fisherman used a gaff to haul the tuna aboard
Keep the gaff ready when that marlin gets close
His gaff about her age ruined the dinner party
The politician's gaff became headline news within hours

definitions: cloth or device placed in mouth to prevent speaking
joke or amusing story or act especially in performance
examples: The kidnappers used a gag to silence their victim
The dentist removed the rubber gag after the procedure
The comedian's sight gag got the biggest laugh tonight
That running gag appears in every episode they produce

definitions: instrument for measuring or testing something
valuable object given as pledge or security
examples: The pressure gage showed dangerous levels in the boiler
Use this thickness gage to check the metal sheets
He threw down his glove as gage of challenge
The ring served as gage of their engagement promise

definitions: state of being cheerful and full of fun or high spirits
examples: The gaiety of the carnival lifted everyone's spirits considerably
Her natural gaiety made her popular at social gatherings

definitions: person or thing that gains especially profit or advantage
backward dive with forward rotation done from diving board
examples: Tech stocks were the biggest gainers in today's market
She emerged as the clear gainer from the merger
The diver executed a perfect gainer from the platform
He practiced his gainer dive throughout the summer months

definitions: manner of walking or moving on foot characteristic of person or animal
examples: The horse's smooth gait made for comfortable riding experience
His unusual gait resulted from an old sports injury

definitions: informal term for girl or woman
examples: The gals met every Friday for their book club
She's a tough gal who can handle any challenge

definitions: special festive occasion often involving entertainment and formal dress
examples: The charity gala raised millions for medical research programs
She wore an elegant gown to the opening night gala

definitions: simple sugar found in dairy products that combines with glucose to form lactose
examples: Galactose metabolism disorders can cause serious health problems early
The body converts galactose to glucose for energy production

definitions: very strong wind typically between thirty-nine and fifty-four miles per hour
loud outburst especially of laughter
examples: The gale knocked down trees and power lines overnight
Ships stayed in port during the dangerous winter gale
Her joke triggered gales of laughter from the audience
The comedian's routine produced gales of uncontrollable laughter

definitions: bitter secretion produced by liver stored in gallbladder
bold impudent behavior or attitude showing lack of respect
abnormal swelling on plant caused by insects or disease
examples: The surgeon removed stones blocking the flow of gall
Gall helps digest fats in the small intestine effectively
She had the gall to criticize after arriving late
His gall in demanding a raise shocked his supervisor
The oak gall contained wasp larvae developing inside slowly
Gall formations can weaken or kill affected tree branches

definitions: brave or heroic person especially in battle
man who is particularly attentive to women
examples: The gallant rescued children from the burning building courageously
Medieval gallants competed in tournaments for ladies' favor
The old gallant still opened doors for every woman
He played the gallant at formal social occasions consistently

definitions: courageous behavior especially in battle or dangerous situations
polite attention or respect shown to women
examples: The soldier received medals for gallantry under enemy fire
Their gallantry in defending the fort became legendary quickly
His old-fashioned gallantry charmed the dinner party guests
Such gallantry seems rare in modern dating culture today

definitions: small organ beneath liver that stores bile for digestion
examples: The gallbladder releases bile when fatty foods enter intestines
Gallstones formed in her gallbladder causing severe pain attacks

definitions: large sailing ship with three or more masts used from fifteenth to eighteenth centuries
examples: Spanish galleons transported gold from the Americas to Europe
The sunken galleon contained treasures worth millions today

definitions: kitchen on ship or aircraft
low flat ship propelled by oars used in ancient times
long tray holding composed type for printing
examples: The cruise ship's galley prepared meals for thousands daily
Smoke from the galley indicated dinner was being prepared
Roman galleys dominated Mediterranean naval warfare for centuries long
Slaves rowed the galley under harsh conditions continuously
The printer arranged metal type in the galley carefully
Check the galley proof before final printing begins tomorrow

definitions: soft silvery metallic element that melts at low temperature used in semiconductors
examples: Gallium melts in your hand at body temperature easily
The electronics industry uses gallium in LED production extensively

definitions: fastest gait of horse with all feet leaving ground together
very fast pace or rate of movement or progress
examples: The horse broke into a gallop across the open field
She heard the gallop of hooves approaching the barn
Development proceeded at a gallop to meet the deadline
Inflation increased at a gallop throughout the troubled year

definitions: wooden frame with noose for hanging condemned criminals
examples: The old gallows stood as grim reminder of frontier justice
Crowds gathered to watch executions at the public gallows

definitions: chess opening sacrificing piece for positional advantage
calculated move or stratagem to gain advantage
examples: The queen's gambit remains popular among chess players worldwide
He declined the gambit preferring solid defensive play
Her conversational gambit steered discussion toward her expertise
The politician's gambit backfired when voters saw through it

definitions: risky action or decision hoping for favorable outcome despite uncertainty
examples: Starting the business was a gamble that paid off
Every investment involves some gamble with your money

definitions: person who gambles money regularly or as profession
examples: The professional gambler studied odds before placing any bets
Compulsive gamblers often lose more than they can afford

definitions: activity of betting money on uncertain outcomes in games or events
examples: Gambling addiction destroyed his family finances and relationships completely
The state legalized gambling to increase tax revenue significantly

definitions: person employed to breed and protect game animals on estate
examples: The gamekeeper patrolled the estate watching for poachers nightly
Our gamekeeper maintains optimal conditions for pheasant breeding

definitions: traditional Indonesian orchestra mainly using percussion instruments like gongs and metallophones
examples: The gamelan performance mesmerized audiences with hypnotic rhythms
Learning gamelan requires understanding complex interlocking patterns

definitions: mature reproductive cell that unites with another to form new organism
examples: Sperm and egg cells are gametes in human reproduction
Plant gametes fuse during fertilization to create seeds

definitions: practice of playing games of chance for money
activity of playing video or computer games
examples: Nevada's gaming industry generates billions in revenue annually
Gaming regulations protect consumers from fraudulent casino practices
Online gaming connects millions of players worldwide every day
The gaming industry surpassed movies in entertainment revenue

definitions: third letter of Greek alphabet
penetrating electromagnetic radiation of extremely short wavelength
examples: Gamma is used to represent various constants in mathematics
The gamma symbol appears frequently in physics equations
Gamma rays can penetrate thick lead shielding easily
Doctors use gamma radiation to treat certain cancers

definitions: ham that has been cured or smoked like bacon
victory in backgammon before opponent bears off any pieces
examples: She served gammon with pineapple for the holiday dinner
The butcher recommended their specially cured gammon joint
He scored a gammon by trapping his opponent's pieces
Achieving gammon doubles the stakes in tournament play

definitions: complete range or scope of something from one extreme to another
examples: Her emotions ran the gamut from joy to despair
The store offers the full gamut of outdoor equipment

definitions: adult male goose
informal quick look or glance at something
examples: The gander protected his mate and goslings aggressively
A large gander led the flock across the meadow
Take a gander at these blueprints before the meeting
I had a quick gander at the menu prices

definitions: world of organized crime and criminal gangs
examples: The gangland shooting shocked the quiet neighborhood residents deeply
Police investigated connections to gangland drug trafficking operations

definitions: structure containing cluster of nerve cell bodies
benign cyst filled with fluid typically near joint or tendon
examples: The spinal ganglion transmits sensory information to the brain
Damage to this ganglion caused numbness in her arm
The ganglion on her wrist disappeared without treatment eventually
Doctors drained the painful ganglion using a needle

definitions: death and decay of body tissue due to lack of blood supply
examples: Untreated frostbite can lead to gangrene requiring amputation
The surgeon removed tissue affected by gangrene immediately

definitions: member of urban street gang
style of rap music featuring gang-related themes and lifestyle
examples: The movie portrayed the gangsta lifestyle realistically and brutally
Former gangstas spoke to students about avoiding crime
Gangsta rap emerged from Los Angeles in the late 1980s
The gangsta image sells records but promotes negative stereotypes

definitions: member of organized crime group especially from prohibition era
examples: Al Capone became America's most notorious gangster during prohibition
The gangster controlled illegal gambling throughout the city

definitions: movable bridge or ramp for boarding or leaving ship
narrow passage between rows of seats or through crowd
examples: Passengers boarded the cruise ship via the main gangway
The crew raised the gangway before departure time
Make gangway for the paramedics to reach the patient
The usher led us down the gangway to our seats

definitions: marijuana especially as used in Jamaica and India
examples: Rastafarians consider ganja a sacred herb for meditation
The police found illegal ganja growing in hidden greenhouses
